See Also:
Constant Field Values

enable_logging

private static boolean enable_logging
Flag for enabling logging. Definitely recommended; if no logging is performed, all logging messages will be ignored, no files created. LinkedList will remain null.

LOG_LOCATION

public static final java.lang.String LOG_LOCATION
The base location where all log files are stored.

Method Detail

initializeLogs

public static void initializeLogs()
                           throws InitializedLogFileException,
                                  java.io.IOException
Initializes log files by creating the linked list which holds log files and adding individual pre-defined log file types to it, which can be accessed by *_LOG integer variables.

Throws:
InitializedLogFileException
java.io.IOException

writeToLog

public static void writeToLog(int LOGFILE,
                              java.lang.String TYPE,
                              java.lang.String message)
Writes to log file specified by parameters, will also flush after every write. Since recording behavior is important especially leading up to any issues the program may encounter, data integrity is a high priority. Logs should not be used frequently for debugging messages (those should probably go to system.out)

Parameters:
LOGFILE - Type of Logfile to write to, such as the connection log file
TYPE - Style of log entry, whether line represents an error, warning, or simple message
message - String message to write to log file.

closeAllLogs

public static void closeAllLogs()
Goes through the linked list using an iterator to close all log files.

flushAllLogs

public static void flushAllLogs()
                         throws java.io.IOException
Throws:
java.io.IOException
